016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.SharedPreferences;
020import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
021import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
022import androidx.preference.PreferenceManager;
023import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
024import javax.inject.Inject;
025import javax.inject.Singleton;
026import kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1;
027
028/**
029 * Implements a {@link LiveData}-based repository of preferences. It does not provide any preference
030 * mutation methods, and is of most use when all preferences are being modified through user
031 * interaction with an instance of a {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass
032 * (such as {@link edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.controller.SettingsActivity.SettingsFragment}).
033 */
034@Singleton
035public class PreferencesRepository {
036
037  private final MutableLiveData<SharedPreferences> preferences;
038  private final SharedPreferences prefs;
039
040  @Inject
041  PreferencesRepository(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
042    prefs = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(context);
043    preferences = new MutableLiveData<>(prefs);
044    prefs.registerOnSharedPreferenceChangeListener((prefs, key) -> preferences.postValue(prefs));
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Returns {@link LiveData} of all shared preferences that have been set in application code or by
049   * the user in a {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass instance. A
050   * viewmodel should then use {@link androidx.lifecycle.Transformations#map(LiveData, Function1)}
051   * (or a similar mechanism) to map the entire {@link SharedPreferences} instance in the
052   * {@link LiveData} returned by this method to {@link LiveData} fields for individual
053   * preferences.
054   */
055  public LiveData<SharedPreferences> getPreferences() {
056    return preferences;
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Utility method to allow pass-through read access to the underlying {@link SharedPreferences},
061   * by key. The compiler will infer the type parameter {@code T} by examining the
062   * {@code defaultValue} and the reference type of the assignment target (if any); if the inferred
063   * type is not one supported as a Shared
064   * @param key
065   * @param defaultValue
066   * @return
067   * @param <T>
068   */
069  public <T> T get(String key, T defaultValue) {
070    //noinspection unchecked
071    T result = (T) prefs.getAll().get(key);
072    return (result != null) ? result : defaultValue;
073  }
074
075}
